metadata.title: CVE-2015-4493 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the stagefright::ESDS::parseESDescriptorfunction in libstagefright in Mozilla Firefox before 40.0 and Firefox ESR38.x before 38.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via aninvalid size field in an esds chunk in MPEG-4 video data, a related issueto CVE-2015-1539.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
